arm_group.description: children were given ad libitum access to raisins for 15 min
children were given ad libitum access to grapes for 15 min

arm_group.arm_group_label: Snack foods: a mix of almonds with raisins
arm_group.description: children were given ad libitum access to a mix of almonds with raisins for 15 min
children were given ad libitum access to water

brief_summary.textblock:
No studies have reported the effect of pre-meal snacking on raisins compared to other
      commonly consumed snacks on energy intake in children. Therefore, the objective of the
      current study was to examine appetite and energy intake following consumption of ad libitum
      snack of raisins, grapes or mix of almonds and raisins, compared with a water control, on
      appetite and food intake 30 min later in 8 - 11 y old normal weight children.  The
      investigators hypothesized that raisins would lower subsequent energy intake in children and
      reduce hunger.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Ad Libitum Pre-Meal Raisin Snack on Satiety and Food Intake in Children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: healthy boys and girls between 8-11 y Exclusion criteria: learning and
        behavioral problems
